credit_line: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 222.3 x 205.7 cm (7 ft. 3 1/2 in. x 6 ft. 9 in.)
title: Coverlet
provenance: Acquired by the Hershey Story in 1977.
medium:
Medium: cotton, wool
Technique: double cloth
description: Reversible coverlet in dark blue, off-white and light brown in a "single snowball" pattern with double intersecting circles and a pine tree border. Woven in two pieces and stitched together in the center. Fringe along both sides and bottom edge. Top edge is folded over and stitched.
name: Coverlet
